marketNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI drops to 50.4 in April 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau reported that the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 50.4 in April 2024 (versus March 2024: 50.8), but remained above the consensus expectation of 50.3. This result indicates expanding manufacturing activity for the second consecutive month.

marketNews.title: Indonesia may offer dual citizenship to attract overseas workers
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said the Indonesian government plans to offer dual citizenship to people of Indonesian descent. The measure aims to attract skilled Indonesians to return to Indonesia. Luhut did not provide further details. According to the Directorate General of Immigration, nearly 4,000 Indonesians became Singapore citizens between 2019 and 2022.

marketNews.title: Traveloka repays $300 million private credit to lenders
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that PT Traveloka Indonesia has repaid a credit facility worth 300 million US dollars to lenders, including BlackRock Inc. and Orion Capital Asia. Bloomberg sources said Traveloka used internal cash to repay the loan. The facility was obtained in 2022 and matures in 2026. Traveloka is reported to have used only 250 million US dollars of the facility.

tickerNews.title: ASII 1Q24: Resilient Performance Thanks to Diversification; Approves Final Dividend of Rp421 per Share
tickerNews.content:
Astra International (ASII) reported net profit of 7.5 trillion rupiah, down 14.4% year-on-year and 8.4% quarter-on-quarter in 1Q24, equal to 24.1% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Although below expectations, the low net profit was also caused by a decline in the investment value of Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO). Excluding the decline in investment values, ASII's net profit for 1Q24 would have been a resilient 8.1 trillion rupiah, equal to 26.3% of the FY24 consensus and in line with expectations.

By segment, Automotive and United Tractors (UNTR) weighed on ASII's performance, while Financial Services were the main support. Details:

Automotive – operating profit fell 45.8% YoY, though it improved quarter-on-quarter. The decline was due to higher selling expenses (+4.7% YoY) and higher general and administrative expenses (+8.3% YoY), while revenue remained relatively stable (+0% YoY, +17.6% QoQ). Management explained that maintaining revenue despite a 20% YoY drop in vehicle sales volume was achieved by selling higher-priced models such as Innova Zennix and Yaris Cross.

United Tractors (UNTR) – operating profit fell 8.5% YoY and 22.6% QoQ, driven by weakness in heavy equipment and coal mining sales. However, the mining contractor segment recorded good performance and supported UNTR's results (https://stockbit.com/post/14585749).

Financial Services – operating profit grew 19.1% YoY and 5.0% QoQ, driven by strong consumer financing in automotive, motorcycle and heavy equipment segments.

In addition to Financial Services, ASII's performance was supported by solid results from associated entities and joint ventures. Net profit of associated entities and JVs grew to 2.6 trillion rupiah (+5.2% YoY, +16.0% QoQ), supported by a higher profit of PT Astra Honda Motor of 2.4 trillion rupiah (+4.0% YoY).

Key Takeaway

We assess ASII's 1Q24 performance as fairly good. Amid a slowdown in automotive sales (https://www.cnbcindonesia.com/news/20240325140713-4-525188/penjualan-motor-mobil-anjlok-tanda-kantong-orang-ri-seret), ASII's net profit excluding investment value declines fell only 5% YoY. Positive performance from Financial Services, Mining Contractor (under UNTR), and associated entities and JVs helped offset weaknesses, showing stability due to diversification.

We also consider that various bad news has already been reflected in ASII's share price, limiting further downside risk. With a low valuation (7x 1-Year Forward P/E), ASII offers an attractive risk-reward profile.

At the shareholders meeting on Tuesday (30/4), ASII shareholders approved a final dividend of 421 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 8.2%.

tickerNews.title: BUKA records first positive Adjusted EBITDA
tickerNews.content: BUKA recorded a net loss of 39 billion rupiah in 1Q24, a sharp improvement from a loss of 1.0 trillion rupiah in 1Q23 and a loss of 593 billion rupiah in 4Q23. In 1Q24, adjusted EBITDA turned positive for the first time at 15 billion rupiah (1Q23: negative 209 billion rupiah; 4Q23: negative 46 billion rupiah), marking a new milestone for the company.

tickerNews.title: BNGA reports net profit of 1.68 trillion rupiah in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) reported net profit of 1.68 trillion rupiah (+6.9% QoQ, +6.3% YoY) in 1Q24, surpassing expectations by reaching 26.2% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Net interest income was 3.2 trillion rupiah (+3.8% QoQ, -3.6% YoY), with provision expenses of 490 billion rupiah (+115% QoQ, -35% YoY). Operationally, loan disbursements grew 6% YoY, in line with management guidance of +5-7%, though below industry targets from BI and OJK (9-12%). The loan-to-deposit ratio was 84.2% (vs. 1Q23: 82.2%; 4Q23: 89.3%). Net interest margin fell YoY to 4.2% (vs. 1Q23: 4.7%) but rose QoQ (vs. 4Q23: 4.0%).

tickerNews.title: PANI posts net profit of 122 billion rupiah in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) reported net profit of 122 billion rupiah (-32% YoY, 8-times QoQ) in 1Q24. The annual decline was due to a 30% YoY drop in revenue, while the strong quarterly profit was driven by a sharp 56% QoQ reduction in operating expenses.

tickerNews.title: TPMA reports net profit of $5.7 million in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) reported net profit of 5.7 million US dollars (+17.2% YoY, -12.7% QoQ) in 1Q24, equal to 28.1% of the FY24 Stockbit estimate. Revenue fell to 16 million US dollars (-6.4% YoY, -13.8% QoQ), while cost of goods sold declined more sharply (-13.2% YoY, -13.9% QoQ), raising gross margin to 41.02% (vs. 1Q23: 36.4%, 4Q23: 40.95%). General and administrative expenses were mixed (+6.2% YoY, -16.9% QoQ), leading to an operating margin of 33.3% (vs. 1Q23: 29.6%, 4Q23: 32.9%). Net profit growth was also supported by profit from the subsidiary PT Trans Logistik Perkasa, which contributed 1.1 million US dollars (-3.3% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: MYOR records net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah (MYOR) reported net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah (+52.9% YoY, -4.8% QoQ) in 1Q24, equal to 35% of the FY24 consensus estimate, with revenue of approximately 8.8 trillion rupiah (+3.7% YoY, +2.0% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: SSIA announces BYD to occupy 108 hectares in Subang Smartpolitan
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) announced that Chinese electric-vehicle manufacturer BYD will occupy a land area of 108 hectares in Subang Smartpolitan, with the transaction value undisclosed. The deal makes BYD the largest tenant of Subang Smartpolitan, with land handover targeted for August 2024. BYD plans to construct the plant in phases and aims to start operations in January 2026.

tickerNews.title: HRUM eyes nickel asset acquisitions and possible IPO amid market recovery
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Harum Energy, Ray Antonio Gunara, said the company is still targeting nickel mine acquisitions as part of its energy transition strategy. Ray also mentioned that HRUM is considering an IPO for one of its nickel business units if market conditions improve. HRUM has acquired three nickel smelters and aims for nickel to contribute 50% of total 2024 revenue, up from 10% in 2023. Additionally, HRUM plans to comply with the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act to gain access to Western markets.

tickerNews.title: AKRA to distribute final dividend of 50 rupiah per share for FY2023
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) will distribute a final dividend for fiscal year 2023 of 50 rupiah per share. The dividend will be cum on the regular and negotiation markets on 8 May 2024, with payment on 27 May 2024. Based on AKRA's closing price of 1,675 rupiah per share on Tuesday (30/4), the final dividend yield is estimated at 2.9%. Previously, AKRA paid an interim dividend of 50 rupiah per share in August 2023 and an interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share in November 2023.

tickerNews.title: SMSM to distribute interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna (SMSM) will distribute an interim dividend of 143.96 billion rupiah, equivalent to 25 rupiah per share. The dividend will be cum on the regular and negotiation markets on 8 May 2024, with payment on 28 May 2024. Based on SMSM's closing price of 1,800 rupiah per share on Tuesday (30/4), the dividend yield is estimated at 1.4%. Previously, SMSM paid interim dividends for fiscal year 2023 three times: 30 rupiah per share in November 2023, 25 rupiah per share in August 2023, and 25 rupiah per share in May 2023.
